lines.text: Enter ALONSO, SEBASTIAN, ANTONIO, GONZALO, ADRIAN, FRANCISCO, and others

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Beseech you, sir, be merry; you have cause, So have we all, of joy; for our escape Is much beyond our loss. Our hint of woe Is common; every day some sailor's wife, The masters of some merchant and the merchant Have just our theme of woe; but for the miracle, I mean our preservation, few in millions Can speak like us: then wisely, good sir, weigh Our sorrow with our comfort.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Prithee, peace.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: He receives comfort like cold porridge.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: The visitor will not give him o'er so.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Look he's winding up the watch of his wit; by and by it will strike.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Sir,--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: One: tell.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: When every grief is entertain'd that's offer'd, Comes to the entertainer--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: A dollar.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Dolour comes to him, indeed: you have spoken truer than you purposed.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: You have taken it wiselier than I meant you should.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Therefore, my lord,--

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Fie, what a spendthrift is he of his tongue!

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: I prithee, spare.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Well, I have done: but yet,--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: He will be talking.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Which, of he or Adrian, for a good wager, first begins to crow?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: The old cock.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: The cockerel.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Done. The wager?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: A laughter.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: A match!

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: Though this island seem to be desert,--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Ha, ha, ha! So, you're paid.

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: Uninhabitable and almost inaccessible,--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Yet,--

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: Yet,--

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: He could not miss't.

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: It must needs be of subtle, tender and delicate temperance.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Temperance was a delicate wench.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Ay, and a subtle; as he most learnedly delivered.

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: The air breathes upon us here most sweetly.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: As if it had lungs and rotten ones.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Or as 'twere perfumed by a fen.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Here is everything advantageous to life.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: True; save means to live.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Of that there's none, or little.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: How lush and lusty the grass looks! how green!

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: The ground indeed is tawny.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: With an eye of green in't.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: He misses not much.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: No; he doth but mistake the truth totally.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: But the rarity of it is,--which is indeed almost beyond credit,--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: As many vouched rarities are.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: That our garments, being, as they were, drenched in the sea, hold notwithstanding their freshness and glosses, being rather new-dyed than stained with salt water.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: If but one of his pockets could speak, would it not say he lies?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Ay, or very falsely pocket up his report

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Methinks our garments are now as fresh as when we put them on first in Afric, at the marriage of the king's fair daughter Claribel to the King of Tunis.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: 'Twas a sweet marriage, and we prosper well in our return.

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: Tunis was never graced before with such a paragon to their queen.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Not since widow Dido's time.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Widow! a pox o' that! How came that widow in? widow Dido!

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: What if he had said 'widower AEneas' too? Good Lord, how you take it!

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: 'Widow Dido' said you? you make me study of that: she was of Carthage, not of Tunis.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: This Tunis, sir, was Carthage.

lines.speaker: adrian
lines.text: Carthage?

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I assure you, Carthage.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: His word is more than the miraculous harp; he hath raised the wall and houses too.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: What impossible matter will he make easy next?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I think he will carry this island home in his pocket and give it his son for an apple.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: And, sowing the kernels of it in the sea, bring forth more islands.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Ay.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Why, in good time.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Sir, we were talking that our garments seem now as fresh as when we were at Tunis at the marriage of your daughter, who is now queen.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: And the rarest that e'er came there.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Bate, I beseech you, widow Dido.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: O, widow Dido! ay, widow Dido.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Is not, sir, my doublet as fresh as the first day I wore it? I mean, in a sort.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: That sort was well fished for.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: When I wore it at your daughter's marriage?

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: You cram these words into mine ears against The stomach of my sense. Would I had never Married my daughter there! for, coming thence, My son is lost and, in my rate, she too, Who is so far from Italy removed I ne'er again shall see her. O thou mine heir Of Naples and of Milan, what strange fish Hath made his meal on thee?

lines.speaker: francisco
lines.text: Sir, he may live: I saw him beat the surges under him, And ride upon their backs; he trod the water, Whose enmity he flung aside, and breasted The surge most swoln that met him; his bold head 'Bove the contentious waves he kept, and oar'd Himself with his good arms in lusty stroke To the shore, that o'er his wave-worn basis bow'd, As stooping to relieve him: I not doubt He came alive to land.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: No, no, he's gone.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Sir, you may thank yourself for this great loss, That would not bless our Europe with your daughter, But rather lose her to an African; Where she at least is banish'd from your eye, Who hath cause to wet the grief on't.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Prithee, peace.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: You were kneel'd to and importuned otherwise By all of us, and the fair soul herself Weigh'd between loathness and obedience, at Which end o' the beam should bow. We have lost your son, I fear, for ever: Milan and Naples have More widows in them of this business' making Than we bring men to comfort them: The fault's your own.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: So is the dear'st o' the loss.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: My lord Sebastian, The truth you speak doth lack some gentleness And time to speak it in: you rub the sore, When you should bring the plaster.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Very well.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: And most chirurgeonly.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: It is foul weather in us all, good sir, When you are cloudy.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Foul weather?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Very foul.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Had I plantation of this isle, my lord,--

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: He'ld sow't with nettle-seed.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Or docks, or mallows.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: And were the king on't, what would I do?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: 'Scape being drunk for want of wine.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I' the commonwealth I would by contraries Execute all things; for no kind of traffic Would I admit; no name of magistrate; Letters should not be known; riches, poverty, And use of service, none; contract, succession, Bourn, bound of land, tilth, vineyard, none; No use of metal, corn, or wine, or oil; No occupation; all men idle, all; And women too, but innocent and pure; No sovereignty;--

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Yet he would be king on't.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: The latter end of his commonwealth forgets the beginning.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: All things in common nature should produce Without sweat or endeavour: treason, felony, Sword, pike, knife, gun, or need of any engine, Would I not have; but nature should bring forth, Of its own kind, all foison, all abundance, To feed my innocent people.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: No marrying 'mong his subjects?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: None, man; all idle: whores and knaves.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I would with such perfection govern, sir, To excel the golden age.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: God save his majesty!

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Long live Gonzalo!

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: And,--do you mark me, sir?

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Prithee, no more: thou dost talk nothing to me.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I do well believe your highness; and did it to minister occasion to these gentlemen, who are of such sensible and nimble lungs that they always use to laugh at nothing.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: 'Twas you we laughed at.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Who in this kind of merry fooling am nothing to you: so you may continue and laugh at nothing still.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: What a blow was there given!

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: An it had not fallen flat-long.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: You are gentlemen of brave metal; you would lift the moon out of her sphere, if she would continue in it five weeks without changing.
Enter ARIEL, invisible, playing solemn music

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: We would so, and then go a bat-fowling.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Nay, good my lord, be not angry.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: No, I warrant you; I will not adventure my discretion so weakly. Will you laugh me asleep, for I am very heavy?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Go sleep, and hear us.
All sleep except ALONSO, SEBASTIAN, and ANTONIO

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: What, all so soon asleep! I wish mine eyes Would, with themselves, shut up my thoughts: I find They are inclined to do so.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Please you, sir, Do not omit the heavy offer of it: It seldom visits sorrow; when it doth, It is a comforter.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: We two, my lord, Will guard your person while you take your rest, And watch your safety.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Thank you. Wondrous heavy.
ALONSO sleeps. Exit ARIEL

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: What a strange drowsiness possesses them!

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: It is the quality o' the climate.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Why Doth it not then our eyelids sink? I find not Myself disposed to sleep.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Nor I; my spirits are nimble. They fell together all, as by consent; They dropp'd, as by a thunder-stroke. What might, Worthy Sebastian? O, what might?--No more:-- And yet me thinks I see it in thy face, What thou shouldst be: the occasion speaks thee, and My strong imagination sees a crown Dropping upon thy head.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: What, art thou waking?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Do you not hear me speak?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I do; and surely It is a sleepy language and thou speak'st Out of thy sleep. What is it thou didst say? This is a strange repose, to be asleep With eyes wide open; standing, speaking, moving, And yet so fast asleep.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Noble Sebastian, Thou let'st thy fortune sleep--die, rather; wink'st Whiles thou art waking.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Thou dost snore distinctly; There's meaning in thy snores.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: I am more serious than my custom: you Must be so too, if heed me; which to do Trebles thee o'er.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Well, I am standing water.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: I'll teach you how to flow.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Do so: to ebb Hereditary sloth instructs me.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: O, If you but knew how you the purpose cherish Whiles thus you mock it! how, in stripping it, You more invest it! Ebbing men, indeed, Most often do so near the bottom run By their own fear or sloth.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Prithee, say on: The setting of thine eye and cheek proclaim A matter from thee, and a birth indeed Which throes thee much to yield.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Thus, sir: Although this lord of weak remembrance, this, Who shall be of as little memory When he is earth'd, hath here almost persuade,-- For he's a spirit of persuasion, only Professes to persuade,--the king his son's alive, 'Tis as impossible that he's undrown'd And he that sleeps here swims.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I have no hope That he's undrown'd.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: O, out of that 'no hope' What great hope have you! no hope that way is Another way so high a hope that even Ambition cannot pierce a wink beyond, But doubt discovery there. Will you grant with me That Ferdinand is drown'd?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: He's gone.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Then, tell me, Who's the next heir of Naples?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Claribel.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: She that is queen of Tunis; she that dwells Ten leagues beyond man's life; she that from Naples Can have no note, unless the sun were post-- The man i' the moon's too slow--till new-born chins Be rough and razorable; she that--from whom? We all were sea-swallow'd, though some cast again, And by that destiny to perform an act Whereof what's past is prologue, what to come In yours and my discharge.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: What stuff is this! how say you? 'Tis true, my brother's daughter's queen of Tunis; So is she heir of Naples; 'twixt which regions There is some space.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: A space whose every cubit Seems to cry out, 'How shall that Claribel Measure us back to Naples? Keep in Tunis, And let Sebastian wake.' Say, this were death That now hath seized them; why, they were no worse Than now they are. There be that can rule Naples As well as he that sleeps; lords that can prate As amply and unnecessarily As this Gonzalo; I myself could make A chough of as deep chat. O, that you bore The mind that I do! what a sleep were this For your advancement! Do you understand me?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Methinks I do.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: And how does your content Tender your own good fortune?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I remember You did supplant your brother Prospero.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: True: And look how well my garments sit upon me; Much feater than before: my brother's servants Were then my fellows; now they are my men.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: But, for your conscience?

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Ay, sir; where lies that? if 'twere a kibe, 'Twould put me to my slipper: but I feel not This deity in my bosom: twenty consciences, That stand 'twixt me and Milan, candied be they And melt ere they molest! Here lies your brother, No better than the earth he lies upon, If he were that which now he's like, that's dead; Whom I, with this obedient steel, three inches of it, Can lay to bed for ever; whiles you, doing thus, To the perpetual wink for aye might put This ancient morsel, this Sir Prudence, who Should not upbraid our course. For all the rest, They'll take suggestion as a cat laps milk; They'll tell the clock to any business that We say befits the hour.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Thy case, dear friend, Shall be my precedent; as thou got'st Milan, I'll come by Naples. Draw thy sword: one stroke Shall free thee from the tribute which thou payest; And I the king shall love thee.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Draw together; And when I rear my hand, do you the like, To fall it on Gonzalo.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: O, but one word.
They talk apart
Re-enter ARIEL, invisible

lines.speaker: ariel
lines.text: My master through his art foresees the danger That you, his friend, are in; and sends me forth-- For else his project dies--to keep them living. While you here do snoring lie, Open-eyed conspiracy His time doth take. If of life you keep a care, Shake off slumber, and beware: Awake, awake!
Sings in GONZALO's ear

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Then let us both be sudden.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Now, good angels Preserve the king.
They wake

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Why, how now? ho, awake! Why are you drawn? Wherefore this ghastly looking?

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Whiles we stood here securing your repose, Even now, we heard a hollow burst of bellowing Like bulls, or rather lions: did't not wake you? It struck mine ear most terribly.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: I heard nothing.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: O, 'twas a din to fright a monster's ear, To make an earthquake! sure, it was the roar Of a whole herd of lions.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Heard you this, Gonzalo?

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Upon mine honour, sir, I heard a humming, And that a strange one too, which did awake me: I shaked you, sir, and cried: as mine eyes open'd, I saw their weapons drawn: there was a noise, That's verily. 'Tis best we stand upon our guard, Or that we quit this place; let's draw our weapons.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Lead off this ground; and let's make further search For my poor son.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Heavens keep him from these beasts! For he is, sure, i' the island.

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Lead away.

lines.speaker: ariel
lines.text: Prospero my lord shall know what I have done: So, king, go safely on to seek thy son.
Exeunt
